text:
I began going to see Foad at Mind & Body a little over a month ago, and already, I can see a marked improvement in my symptoms. For example, I was unable to turn my neck all the way to the right for about a month when I first saw him.  Foad repaired that in two sessions.

In addition, he makes it an extremely comfortable and easy assessment process. I never got the sense that I was next in line, or that I needed to be in a hurry. The atmosphere is quiet, relaxing, and tranquil. He makes all of his oils home made, and they are incredible. He gives feedback, suggestions, and has a wholistic approach--all without making you feel like you've done something wrong, or haven't done something you were supposed to to take better care of yourself.

Very reasonable priced, very effective, and very easy to do in the middle of a day.

text: The gallery is beautiful. However, prices are very high and they only had coffee, no food.

resp.text: I'm glad you liked our Gallery.  We try to have a wide range of art,  ranging in price from $15 to $10,000.  Prior to COVID, we served fresh pastries.  When we re-opened after COVID, we weren't able to sell the pastries, so have temporarily stopped serving them.  We do have some snack items, but we never intended to be a restaurant--Just an art Gallery with an espresso bar.  Google had automatically labelled us as an "Art Cafe", and perhaps that has caused some confusion.  I have changed the Google Classification to more accurately reflect our offerings.  Thank you for your comments and we hope to see you again soon!

I loved visiting this home! will bring out of town guests.

text: Beautiful antique furniture with a great history told by a wonderful tour guide. Must see!

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This is a museum in the private home of artist and poet (Maria) Howard Weeden. The cost is $5 and the tour is about an hour long. I found it to be a fascinating glimpse into not only Weeden's life and art, but also the early history of Huntsville and North Alabama. Like many private museums, Weeden house has had to branch out to make ends meet so they rent the place out as an event venue as well. This means that Lynn, their lone employee is stretched rather thin as tour guide, event coordinator, curator and hostess so you should make an appointment for the guided tour. Nevertheless, she was as gracious and informative a hostess as you could wish for. Word of caution- there are stairs so if you have mobility issues you may miss the upstairs part of the tour.

name: Ken Barnes
text:
Our wedding and reception was in the back yard of the Weeden House. We had lots of questions and requests, and their event/property manager was incredibly flexible and responsive. It was a magical event, and the Weeden House was a huge part of making it feel special.

Note: it's one of the few facilities in Huntsville that does weddings but allows you to bring your own alcoholic drinks. No forced catering!

name: James Chamberlain
text: Has an expanded exhibit for the Alabama Bicentennial. From February 1-March 7 2019. The home, furnishings, paintings, etc. give a good sense of life before and after the Civil War. Great way to learn more about local Huntsville area history. Guides knowledgeable and helpful.

name: Jeremy Lewis
text: Fun and quirky store of local arts and crafts, along busy Madison Ave commuter road, so parking on street requires care during rush hour. The paintings on the walls are by local primitives, with bright colors and two dimensions. There are examples of costume jewelry and pottery, likewise in the folk art genre. (This ain't SCAD or RISD). The treasure I found is a children's book written, drawn and produced by Tom Spencer, "Riley, Ace of Spies" with delightful illustrations by the author. In the best tradition, the text is as amusing on an adult level as for children.

name: Andrew Farrow
text: It is a beautiful building, but certainly not what one would expect. It is very tranquil Japanese style of architecture. When you first walk in you are greeted by a macaw and an African grey parrot and extremely friendly staff. The at they have is very nice and a lot of revolutionary America style themes pieces of art. I was really looking forward to seeing the civil war exhibits they have advertised on their website but the only one that was on display was a bust of Robert E. Lee. Definitely a neat little place to check out of you have time.

name: Amanda Paine
text: I enjoyed the artwork and the grounds, but the cages the macaw and African Grey were in were depressing. No toys. No variety in the perch sizes. No mirrors. They were really too small for birds that size. Bama seems to have pulled out all his tail feathers to have something to do. The cages and the floor around them were also filthy. The birds are clearly not as important as the beautiful grass that surrounds the buildings. That was clear to me.

From gorgeous antiques to fun gifts, and everything in between- it's like a small excellently curated museum where all the items can be purchased!!!
And the owners are extremely friendly, have great taste and will assist you in finding the perfect gift for children, the person who's impossible to shop for, and even something extraordinary for yourself (like the beautiful jewelry, handbags, or humorous hand-towels, keychains...) Really there is something for EVERYONE here!

name: Kitten Kaos
text:
I have taken two classes with Stacy at the Mill over this summer.

The Octopus class was incredibly detailed and amazingly cool. Nothing held back; Stacy is invested in her students having as much success as possible in the process. She was accommodating to my flight schedule and carry-on restrictions and worked with me on the things I could not bring on the plane. The class was fun and I got to meet and make new friends with a great bunch of clay folk. And, I made a crazy octopus bowl to boot!

Later in the summer, I was able to take another class, Slip Trailing, on my way to a work seminar. This was a tremendous compliment to the octopus work, and will have applications in a lot of my other work. It adds a dimension (literally) that is not available through glaze or underglaze. She was detailed enough in the chemistry that I was hooked, but not so much that the class was lost. The demos and slip play go a super long way in understanding the intricasies of the process.

Now to the area. Alabama is just lovely! The hot sticky weather that they were having was perfect for my cold northern blood. The flora in Alabama is completely different to mine, and I enjoyed driving around to take it all in. The Mills are an amazing space dedicated to the arts and I could have spent days wandering the booths. And!! Anyone visiting Stacy who is gluten free or paleo; I found the most delightful bakery and eatery. Their dedicated gluten free facility has some of the best stuff, and that includes BEFORE my diagnosis. Try the jalapeno cheddar scones at Mason Dixon Bakery, you’ll never want to leave.

So seriously, if the opportunity comes to have class with Stacy and S.P.Morgan Studios, take it; you will have no regrets.

name: Betsy
text: I have purchased several pieces from Stacy Morgan and every piece is as beautiful and well crafted as the last. The glazes and her techniques make each piece truly special whether it is functional like a great noodle bowl or decorative. Stacy responds quickly and is very helpful. I will keep ordering more.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Betsy! I appreciate your kind words and your support.

name: Kathryn Somers
text: I have taken 2 workshops from Stacy.  She is a wonderful instructor who is able to communicate and demonstrate effectively to her classes.   She is funny, passionate, curious and caring, thoughtful and a fountain of knowledge.   The facility at Lowe Mill in Huntsville is fantastic and her studio there is an artist's dream - open and full of light.    Her work is fully of whimsy and charm and is always flawless in its execution.   I am delighted to have a piece of her work and it makes me smile whenever I walk by it.

resp.text: Thanks, Kathryn! I hope we get to reconnect soon.

name: Cheryl Krebs
text: An incredibly talented potter with a ♡ of gold. I own a few of Stacy’s pieces and enjoy them even more each day. They are durable and SO FUN! I am also a potter so I have pretty high standards for skill and aesthetics... her pieces exceed the quality of most potters and the aesthetics speak for themselves. If you get a chance to meet Stacy... do it... then when you drink from one of her vessels you can think of her and enjoy the moment even more.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Cheryl. I learned by being a part of our community. <3

name: Daniela Perallon
text: I'm so picky about pottery, but Stacy's work is incredibly unique, hitting all the notes from moody and dark to bright and whimsical and everywhere in-between. She's always experimenting with new designs and techniques while maintaining top notch quality. I'm proud to own her artwork! We are running out of room on our mug shelf because we can't stop purchasing her mugs.

name: Kiley Salmon
text: I love every piece that I have from here. They are each so unique and beautiful. If you are like me and love the feel of textures on your hands you will love her work. I don't think that I truly ever appreciated the work that goes in to someone making coffee cups and vases but after touching my first cup and following her page I am always in awe of the things that she can make.

resp.text: Thank you! I appreciate the support.

name: SofaQueen OG
text: Her work is simply mesmerizing, the glaze work is the coolest I've ever seen. I had to get a purple squid mug and it's one of my absolute favorites.  Almost too pretty to use. I've gotten so many compliments on it and considering I've used it at least twice a week since last June, I think it's holding up well for hand made pottery. I look forward to expanding my collection.

name: Brittani Tkacz
text: Stacy Morgan is not only a talented artist, but an excellent business owner who communicates well and is extremely accommodating. I had several questions that she answered quickly, and she shipped my purchase quickly. Upon arrival, I was amazed to find the item I had purchased (one of her awesome frog mugs) was even more beautiful in person. The design is excellent too, as the handle is sooo comfy in my hand! I give SP Morgan Studio my highest recommendation!

resp.text: Thank you, Brittani!

name: Deacon Wolfwood
text: Great shop! Full of wonderful pottery for sale, the owner is super friendly, full of wonderful knowledge, and open for custom orders. Mrs. Morgan has a great idea for detail, has amazing glaze techniques, and some beautifully unique pieces, you simply MUST SEE! 10/10 WILL VISIT AGAIN.  She also has an online shop that is Mobile optimized 💛

name: Daniel Ruiz
text: Simply some of the most amazing functional ceramic art I've ever seen. Stacy's a great person and teacher as well. Visit her, buy some of her stuff. You'll be forever grateful. Makes great gifts too!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Daniel!

name: Lisa Andrew
text: I have been an admirer of Stacy Morgan's beautiful unique pottery for a while, so I jumped on the chance to take one of her workshops.  What a fun, outstanding learning experience.  Stacy is not only a talented artist, but also a skilled communicator and teacher.  I enthusiasically recommend her workshops.  When I can't make it to her studio in person, I keep an eye on her website and jump at the chance to add another piece to my collection.

name: Maria Hathcock
text: Stacy is one of the most creative people I know. After falling in love with her techniques at creating her octopus pieces I decided to make the long trek from Texas to her studio at Lowe Mill in Huntsville, Alabama. Not only did I learn all about how to make pieces with her techniques we also quickly became friends. Her easy manner and southern hospitality were endearing and welcoming. We planned a second trip out with the original group we had but were very disappointed to have to reschedule due to Covid-19. It’s been the highlight of my year to return and take more classes with Stacy.

resp.text: Thank you, Laura. I am holding high hopes we get to have our reunion this fall and I am so looking forward to seeing you all again.

name: Mark Campbell
text: Stacy is a very talented potter and a great person.  Her work is thought provoking and beautiful.  I like that she steps out of normal boundaries. I would recommend her work to anybody.

resp.text: Thank you, Mark!

name: Barbara Russell
text: Ordered a lil mug online & it arrived super fast & very well packed. Craftsmanship is excellent. Texture is silky, mug is lightweight but sturdy. Beautiful & exactly as pictured. Thank you so much Stacy! I'll continue collecting your pieces.

resp.text: Thank you Barbara, for your kind words and continued support.

name: Lisa Malone
text: I am privileged to own several of Stacy’s pieces; each is lovely and unique. When I have ordered online with shipping the pieces have been carefully packed and arrived safely. If you are looking for some amazing art, you’re in the right place!

resp.text: Thank you, Lisa! I so appreciate your support...you’ve been with me since day one and I am forever grateful.

name: Amanda Conger
text: Stacy's mugs are my handsdown favorites. They are a generous size but not to heavy/bulky to hold with a perfect little thumb spot and gorgeous designs. Whenever we open the cupboard, they are the first mugs everyone makes a beeline for. They wash in the dishwasher (nothing fussy) and have held up wonderfully.

resp.text: Thanks, Amanda. There is no finer compliment to a potter than to know their work is being used and loved regularly!

name: Joseph Bott
text: I have dealt with Stacy at S.P Morgan Studio many times. Her work and business are both amazing and respectful. She works hard to treat customers with care and always has a smile on her face. Without a doubt, one of the best pottery people in the business.

name: Dave Edens
text: When visiting Lowe Mill Stacy's studio is always a must stop. On top of the amazing finished works on display, it is a working pottery studio and you can see her at her craft pretty much most of the time. I have a couple of her pieces and they are both wonderful and functional.

resp.text: Thank you, Dave! Always a pleasure to see you!

name: William Wolf
text: Stacy's artwork is sublime. From the everyday objects like mugs and plates, to the fantastic sculptures of sea creatures and fae beings, everything is beautiful, functional, and most of all filled with her love of her art. I would recommend getting your hands on some of it as soon (and as often) as possible.

resp.text: Thank you, William!

name: gail armand
text: Some of my favorite pottery ever. It is in my personal collection and is one of my favorite things to give people I love. Highly distinctive. I would recognize SP Morgan anywhere, including the Smithsonian. Yes, it is that good.

name: Yvonne Castillo
text: Stacy’s art work is stunning with gorgeous details. I’ve had the pleasure of taking classes from her and learned even more than the class was about. Stacy is always makes sure you understand the reason behind the process as well as the process of the class material. I definitely recommend her classes and beautiful art.

name: Darlena Dettmer
text: I absolutely LOVE this place! Each piece is carefully handcrafted with unique detail and made with the finest of quality! I would give S.P. Morgan Studio more than 5 stars if Google had it.

resp.text: Thank you, Darlena!

name: Jules W
text: I love S.P. Morgan's pottery. I love her creative side along with great quality of mugs, bowls and vases. I live out of state and have never had a problem with receiving my items through shipping.

resp.text: Thank you so much. I try my best

name: OkRandom Art
text: Stacey is a prime example of why I work with local artisans. Every time I pick up a piece of her work I learn something new about her process. The transaction is more personal...it comes with a story...and her work is simply stunning . You will not find these things in a department store. Highly recommended.

name: Heidi See
text: I ordered a cup from Stacy. It came really fast. It was packaged very securely the mug arrived in perfect condition and was exactly what i wanted. She even sent me an extra surprise with it. Thank you so much

name: Helen Lien
text: I have purchased several pieces from Stacey for both myself and as gifts. I could not be more satisfied with each and every purchase. Her designs are creative, unique, and well-executed. Be sure to follow her on Facebook to see her latest glaze experiments and works in progress.

name: Robin Lucas
text: I’ve not only purchased Stacy’s fabulous work, but I’ve taken a workshop as well.  She’s a great teacher and the passion in her work shows in every piece she makes.  I’ve been won over as a fan for life!

resp.text: Thanks, Robin!

name: Elizabeth Lobdell
text: I bought 2 lovely mugs from SP Morgan as gifts. I shamelessly kept them and found something else to give. I absolutely love the way they feel in my hand.

name: Tonya Sitko
text: Stacy’s art is amazing. As an example, her octopus bowls and tentacles are simply extraordinary. Highly recommend.

name: Diahn Ott
text: I’m honored to not only own two of Stacy’s pieces, but to have taken a fantastic workshop on slip-trailing with her. She is a truly wonderful teacher, an inspired artist, and I look forward to a time when I can collect some more of her work and take another class.

resp.text: Thank you, Diahn!

name: Kathryn Phelan
text: Love my mug. The textural details and colors are wonderful. The handle and lip edge are very comfortable.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Ronda Bynon
text: Ms. Morgan's potter has a unique quality that makes me keep coming back to purchase something new.  She is also extremely knowledgeable about her art and willing to share that knowledge.

name: Miki Bowman
text: I have a few pieces of her work and I've drooled over many more! Her style is unmistakable and pulls at my heart. Plus, her dog is freakin' awesome.

resp.text: Ha! Thank you! And Whiskey says hello!

name: Susan Burlingame
text: Took a workshop with Stacy. She is generous with her information and process.  A really nice person too.

resp.text: Thank you, Susan!

name: j cole
text: Some of the most beautifully crafted pottery I have ever seen! The octopus pieces are so delicately sculpted and are so incredible!

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: V Wyatt
text: I call it my "Tuesday mug," and have been using it most Tuesdays for at least a couple of years. It has been in the dishwasher and the microwave countless times, and so faithfully continues to bring me visual delight as I trundle through my day.

resp.text: That’ll make a potter smile....love hearing that my work is holding up well to real use!! Thank you!

name: Denise Joyal
text: Wonderfully talented artist. A must-have for your ceramics collection!

resp.text: Denise, I so appreciate the kind words! Thank you.

name: Jeanna Wing
text: This studio has some amazing, original work! Wonderful person, great atmosphere!

name: Brenda Armistead
text: Absolutely LOVE this artist's studio.  Wonderful work, great atmosphere.

name: Rebekah Krieger
text: I love my little cup, it’s well made and arrived quickly!

name: Joanie Nash
text: Stacy is a wonderful teacher. Thank you for everything you do and share.

resp.text: Thank you, Joanie!

name: Rebecca Ziemer
text: Stacy is AWESOME!!!!! Great personality, flawless products, and entertaining as heck.

resp.text: Thanks, Rebecca!

name: ambi dreamt
text: Talented artist & potter living her dream, with a gleam in her eye & a wit to her banter.  Check out her craft!

resp.text: Thank you, Jennifer!

name: Kris Gibson
text: Amazing pottery!

resp.text: Thank you so much, Kris!

name: Robin Bierworth
text: This place is wonderful 😊 They have many shops inside where you can find art, sweets and that special something. They also give the opportunity for local artists to come out and set up a tent/booth every Saturday! It's a great way to spend the day or even a few hours 😉. Definitely recommend this place 👍👍

name: Vic R
text: I enjoy visiting and browsing the vendors shops and checking out the art exhibits featuring local artists. The exhibits rotate so you will see new work often. There are a few good food options on site. They do outdoor concerts here as well; plenty of things for the family

name: Maria Lechtreck
text: This is such a wonderful and remarkable place.  But when I visited on the Saturday of the Memorial Day weekend 2021, along with tons of other visitors, it was disappointing that so few artists were in their studios to meet the visitors and share their stories and sell their creations.  I hope the artists will soon transition into a much faster recovery from COVID.

name: Davida Holiday
text: There are so many things to see, do, and taste at the Lowe Mill! I would recommend that you go on a Saturday (unless you are going for food, treats, or drinks then when they are open anytime is fine, because things right now (probably due to focus) are not really hopping on other days. Everything you see is eye candy! And oh my word, it is so worth it! Great place to take pictures as well!!! So go and soothe your soul with the art and satiate your taste buds with great did and yummy treats!

name: Aaron D. Lee
text: Huntsville staple. Went to shows there back in the early aughts and it is astounding how much it has grown. Check out Guadalupe's pottery (world-class) and Pizelles for some amazing (but definitely upscale-priced) chocolates, coffee, and Italian-style sodas.

name: Sue sad
text: Me and hubby checking out the art nice place to pick up things for the home plenty of  vendors to choose from outside and in try the tea 😋❣

name: Wendy Boustani
text: Really fun and eclectic maker shops. Good on-site eatery. Wall art and public areas are interesting to wander through. Highly recommend for local residents but especially as a pleasant low-key activity to bring out-of-town relatives.

name: Susan Wilke
text: We loved walking around and seeing the artists.  The dragon themed coffee shop was so fun.  Also loved Calvin Hubbard's pottery -- a must see on ground floor of building with dinosaur entrance.  He had many decorative and functional items.  We got a beautiful bowl & mug for a very reasonable price.  💖😊 He was also very friendly and fun to talk to with many years experience making pottery.

name: Debra Jeffery
text: Only visited the first floor, and the outside  areas. Next will be the 2nd floor. My first visit to the Mill, Awesome!  Soo much Talent, Thank you everyone for sharing.

name: J Michael Cobb
text: An incredible location.  A.grand event space.

name: Kayra Dunn
text: Love the atmosphere.  Unique places to eat.  Very different to the usual food.  Got Orchard Peach tea.  Very good.  Follows the safety rules with mask and distancing.

name: Kacey Clark
text: Amazing food. Amazing art. Exciting activities. 10/10. Don't forget to visit the Dragon Forge Cafe!

name: Makenna Gott
text: This is SUCH a cool place!!! So much to see, I didn't have enough time! Can't wait to go back!

name: Lindsay Richer
text:
Beautiful location and building. The outside vendors were sparse and many of the inside vendors were closed. But I can presume this is due to the lingering effects of social distancing.

Our lunch from Poftà Bunà was AMAZING, the tea from Piper & Leaf was outstanding, and sitting outside was perfect.

name: Brandon Whaley
text: A fun place to do all kinds of things. Great for the family as well.

name: C B
text: The Mill is a phenomenal place. No matter who you are and what your interests are,..you can be at home at the mill. The Artists are awesome to shop with and talk to, the Events are Great. Its definitely a place that can enrich you and broaden your spectrums. I love the mill Alone, with My Husband, with my Kids, with my Friends.

name: Hismione Tremblay
text: Over all, a rather nice assortment of artistic venues and store fronts.  Two of the stairwells smell of bat guano due to the bats that inhabit them, which makes me wonder about health code violations due to all the diseases bats can carry, such as rabies for example.   The only elevator we could find was a service use only, not public use.  This would seem to make the building less accessible for those who might need assistance or who have strollers, which we did today.

name: Ryan S
text: Really enjoy going and walking around, looking at all the shops. Lots of amazing artists. A wonderful place to support local. Green pea press on the first floor and Artimaps on the third floor are a couple of my favorite places to visit! Great places to eat, like "The Happy Tummy". Can spend a couple hours here enjoying the beautiful surroundings. Lots of murals and art work throughout the building.

name: James Franklin
text: A real variety of things to see a lot of Talent on display well worth going to

name: Kyle Gott
text: This place is freaking sweet. We went last summer so a lot of places were closed due to COVID. I am looking forward to going this summer to see it with everything open. So many neat local artists and companies there. It’s a very old building so it’s cool how they repurposed it but it still has some of the old structure vibes.

name: Joe Masters
text: This place is so cool. I wish we had something like this at home. It's worth a trip to Huntsville just to go shop here. And bring the dog!

name: Cara Hoffman
text: Fantastic place to see, buy, and learn to make art, along with meeting artists, and watching their processes. Unique food and drink. Diversity and acceptance.

name: Shaun Bloodsworth
text: Always a great place to go enjoy some quiet and walk around. Plenty of amazing artists to visit in their studios, and lots of good food and drink!

name: melissa
text: My children and I LOVE Lowe mill. We always make it a point to go to Dragon's Cafe each time we go.The raspberry Danish? Cookies are so delicious! We get them everytime. We've been trying different teas and coffees on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Lowe mill is just such a unique and fun place. We could spend hours walking the halls and looking at all the artwork and different shops.

name: Dylan Clark
text: You can never have a bad time at Lowe Mill. There's always something to see or do, and every visit manages to be a unique experience even after a dozen trips. Definitely a great place to spend your day & money at - especially for supporting the local community.

name: Abster_ Abbs
text: It's so beautiful there! One of my favorite places to go! Love seeing all the different art and even seeing some of the artist work!

name: Shannon Boyd
text: Amazing Arts and Custom Crafts venue. Individual artists' offerings in a wonderful venue ripe for exploring.  Come when you have plenty of time to explore all three floors. There are even food offerings to keep you fueled.

name: Jessica Flores
text: The people working there are very very very rude!! You had an employee walking around yelling at people to put on their mask ( which they were taking prom pictures) and told a grown man that he should know better and called him Sassy ... I will Never step foot on this property again.

name: Abster_ Abbs
text: It's so beautiful there! One of my favorite places to go! Love seeing all the different art and even seeing some of the artist work!

name: Shaun Bloodsworth
text: Always a great place to go enjoy some quiet and walk around. Plenty of amazing artists to visit in their studios, and lots of good food and drink!

name: melissa
text: My children and I LOVE Lowe mill. We always make it a point to go to Dragon's Cafe each time we go.The raspberry Danish? Cookies are so delicious! We get them everytime. We've been trying different teas and coffees on the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Lowe mill is just such a unique and fun place. We could spend hours walking the halls and looking at all the artwork and different shops.

name: Dylan Clark
text: You can never have a bad time at Lowe Mill. There's always something to see or do, and every visit manages to be a unique experience even after a dozen trips. Definitely a great place to spend your day & money at - especially for supporting the local community.

name: Jessica Flores
text: The people working there are very very very rude!! You had an employee walking around yelling at people to put on their mask ( which they were taking prom pictures) and told a grown man that he should know better and called him Sassy ... I will Never step foot on this property again.

name: Gabriel Haroldson
text: Took my family here over Thanksgiving break. It is a beautiful building and there are lots of different art exhibits and shops inside the building. This is not for families with little kids. They had some pornography type photos and drawings. I think they need a 18+ so people know a head of time. I won’t be bringing my family back here.

name: Brian Keefe
text: So many unique shops and artist.  Great way to spend a Saturday just exploring

name: Stormcrow
text: Great hip place. Lots to do and see

name: Roberto Martins
text:
Amazing space with lots to see. It has a metropolitan vibe that reminds me of New York and Miami's Art Basel, without the crowds of course.

Super enjoyable experience!

name: K Wynn, the Conscious Lifestyle Enthusiast
text: I really enjoy this venue, the atmosphere, and the food is okay. Most of the staff are pretty cool; however, the bartenders are not that friendly with exception of one who is really great! Whoever heard of a bartender(s) needing to work on social skills, right? I'm here supporting R&B Vibes every Tuesday night, so are quite a few other people. Please address the unfriendliness.

name: Erika
text: I love everything about this place. The food and shopping options are excellent. The atmosphere is fun and friendly. I love the exhibitions they have. Fun for hanging out and having date night.

name: Jenni Lanham
text: Expected more booths/shops to be open on a Saturday afternoon.   Really disappointing since we'd brought out of town guests to find unique items.   Not sure we'll ever go back since as this is the second time it's been like this.  Christmas is in 5 weekss so you'd think they'd want to make some money. Best part about the trip was the nice gentleman running the elevator.

name: Robin Settle
text: This is a fun place to walk around. I really like the tea shop.  The guitar shop was neat to visit, also. A lot of the art is not my style and some of it I cannot imagine having in my house (like the painting of the tampon on a bright pink background), but there is also some really cool stuff. Overall, a fun and eclectic experience nut one I only need occassionally.

name: Marcia Taritero
text: Enjoyed The Veggie! Delicious vegan food!

name: James Capps
text: A good place to go and relax a little expensive but good environment.

name: Timothy McCulloch
text: I visited the record store & absolutely loved it. They have a great selection & if ya can't find what you're looking for then they order it. Definitely recommend!

name: JOAN VARGAS
text: Need better sign out side to find its location

name: Jason Ray
text: Amazing community for the arts and artists. Highly recommended.

name: JK C
text: Please support your local artist.  This place along with 805 and a few others are pretty cool to go to.

name: Evans Mcbride
text: The Veggie restaurant is the place to eat. It is my go to  place . That food is good.

name: Robin Settle
text: This is a fun place to walk around. I really like the tea shop.  The guitar shop was neat to visit, also. A lot of the art is not my style and some of it I cannot imagine having in my house (like the painting of the tampon on a bright pink background), but there is also some really cool stuff. Overall, a fun and eclectic experience nut one I only need occassionally.

name: Timothy McCulloch
text: I visited the record store & absolutely loved it. They have a great selection & if ya can't find what you're looking for then they order it. Definitely recommend!

name: JOAN VARGAS
text: Need better sign out side to find its location

name: James Capps
text: A good place to go and relax a little expensive but good environment.

name: Marcia Taritero
text: Enjoyed The Veggie! Delicious vegan food!

name: Pitts Burgher
text: Everyone should go and see all of the local artist and crafters who have their stores set up there. Food and drink are available. Check out 5 Points Elements. Great store.

name: Hector Murrieta
text: Great place to hang out, see art, listen to music, places to paint, etc. Definitely worth a visit (or a dozen).

name: Carla Davis
text:
We set up to sell our jewelry on Saturdays. I am disappointed that there are not more customers people buying to support the artists but the exposure is awesome and we enjoyed networking with other artists and the art community. The only people who bought our art we're from out of town. Get out there Huntsville and support the arts better! Bobby is a killer hairstylist and the food is awesome. Great place to take kids if your looking for something to do in Huntsville.
Lowe Mill is a great place and a must see!

name: Beth Taylor
text: What a fun way to #buylocal! There's really something for everyone, whether you're trying to find a unique gift for a friend or just would like to try some fresh kombucha this is the place for you!

name: Rita Whatley
text:
First time to visit. Was interesting
To see all the different  art . Never been ?.worth giving it a once over.

name: Sophia
text: Beautiful building with lots of fun things to do. I love the STEAM center there and I'm sad to see it go. Still a fun place to go even without the STEAMworks.

name: Harper W. Avent
text: Always a fun place to go for art, food, drinks, or jsut to walk around and hang out. There are so many different stores and vendors here. It seems like there is always something going on around the mill. It never gets old!

name: Stephanie Schrenk
text: There is so much to do and discover at lowe mill! There is always rotating art exhibits so there's always new art to look at, I love going into the artist studios and seeing their stuff for sale and the amazing things they create, and also there are delicious restaurants and an adorable cat cafe. There's also cool things to do like take classes and go to events, so there is always something that you will like or something that you will want to get into at lowe mill.

name: kimbolinarino
text: Important epicenter of art for the greater huntsville community. Has grown tenfold since it's humble beginnings as mostly a venue for local obscure bands and makers, as well as photographers in the early days with just a few anchored shops. Now has studios on every floor, restaurants, a community garden, shops, concerts, classes, all kinds of really awesome stuff and people under one roof. Cultural jewel of Huntsville.

name: Alex P
text: Cool atmosphere, lots of interesting products and services. A great time whether you're going just to walk around or to attend an event or festival.

name: Heather Whitmore
text: Lowe Mill is a great place to find unique gifts and decor for your home. I love supporting the local artists and enjoy their art classes, shows,  and restaurants. We went the other night to grab dinner and watch the "concert on the dock".  The weather was gorgeous and everyone was super friendly.  Had a great time and plan to go again next Friday.

name: Dan P
text: Fun place to hang out, appreciate creativity and art, I would also recommend as an option to anyone looking for a place to buy gifts.

name: Chloe C
text: One of my favorite places in Huntsville. I love all the artists here, whether current or artists that have left. I am biased though seeing as I basically grew up here. Lowe Mill offers some of the most fun events like Comic Con, concerts on the dock, and more. 10/10 would go again

name: Emaley Thomas
text: Absolutely wonderful facility & several excellent art galleries, shops, tea shop, and eateries. Gorgeous grounds & is filled with wonderful souls. Truly one 9f my favorite spots

name: Christy Lang
text: Love the outdoor spaces that are used for community events such as concerts & drive-in movies. Also like walking through the building to see local artists & vendors with their wares. It's quirky & fun.

name: Joanna DeAtley
text: Wonderful place full of amazing art and amazing people.  You'll find anything and everything here from sculptures to paintings to jewelry and more.   There are fantastic spots for food and drink as well.  The whole place is dog friendly and many of the artists adore having dogs visit. It's a great place for a family day.

name: Christopher Hall
text: Im a strong supporter of small business but was told several times I looked like I didn't belong there or I probably didn't have enough money to even be shopping in several of the shops will not be back unless these people can fix there overall attitude thinking they're better than everyone else.

name: Brian White
text: Great wholesome fun for the whole family. Perfect for a date night too. Love this place. Huntsville is lucky to have a place like this.

name: Stephanie Schrenk
text: There is so much to do and discover at lowe mill! There is always rotating art exhibits so there's always new art to look at, I love going into the artist studios and seeing their stuff for sale and the amazing things they create, and also there are delicious restaurants and an adorable cat cafe. There's also cool things to do like take classes and go to events, so there is always something that you will like or something that you will want to get into at lowe mill.

name: Frank Noor
text:
Wow! What a great chill environment. I loved my first time there and will always remember that. Have made plans to make this a regular place to visit.......they always jave events and drive in movies! Great place for a date, a lunch, or just a family outing.

You owe it to yourself to check this spot out,especially if you are in the Huntsville area. Hope you all enjoy it as much as I have

name: Harper W. Avent
text: Always a fun place to go for art, food, drinks, or jsut to walk around and hang out. There are so many different stores and vendors here. It seems like there is always something going on around the mill. It never gets old!

name: Sophia
text: Beautiful building with lots of fun things to do. I love the STEAM center there and I'm sad to see it go. Still a fun place to go even without the STEAMworks.

name: Jenny Lassetter
text: It was our first time there and although we only made it through the expansive first floor we will be visiting again.

name: kimbolinarino
text: Important epicenter of art for the greater huntsville community. Has grown tenfold since it's humble beginnings as mostly a venue for local obscure bands and makers, as well as photographers in the early days with just a few anchored shops. Now has studios on every floor, restaurants, a community garden, shops, concerts, classes, all kinds of really awesome stuff and people under one roof. Cultural jewel of Huntsville.

name: Alura Garrison
text:
This is not only a place that supports local artists, but they also host many fun and helpful events like the A New Leash On Life adoption event/celebration! This is where Todd found his furever family!!!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️
There are some awesome local artists inside, too - gifts for men, women, kids, you name it, and there's probably an artist of that genre there.  Also, Happy Tummy has the BEST lunch foods ever. I used to eat there all the time when I worked at the genomics company that used to be on the other side.
I hear The Chef's food truck outside is fabulous too.

name: Essie Carpenter
text: One of my favorite creative spaces. Great for every member of the family!!!

name: Streeter Michael
text: Pizzells is awesome very good and out of the box chocolate. What a unique way to do a smores

name: susan glandon
text: Such a great place, with a variety of food, dessert, and shopping!

name: Chris Pittson
text: Nice to walk and look around and shop.

name: Jk R
text: Awesome place, great artists just beware the hipsters

name: Tara W.
text: Loved all the local art. And studios there!

name: Joanna DeAtley
text: Wonderful place full of amazing art and amazing people.  You'll find anything and everything here from sculptures to paintings to jewelry and more.   There are fantastic spots for food and drink as well.  The whole place is dog friendly and many of the artists adore having dogs visit. It's a great place for a family day.

name: Erik Walsh
text: Cool art spot with tons to check out.

name: brodie lowery
text: Such a wonderful place! Great shops, restaurants,entertainment and art. There is something for everyone in the family.

name: Jenn Ryan
text:
If you haven't had the chance to visit this place then you are really missing out in one of the hidden gems of Huntsville Alabama. There is absolutely something for everyone here, from one of kind art pieces, to classes, to chocolates, whiskey, ice cream, coffee, sandwiches and painted pieces for your favorite boardgame. Each time I am here I find a new corner to explore, a new food truck to enjoy or a new tea from the tea shop. I cannot wait for my next visit.

If you happen here make sure you check out their live schedule because sometimes there are bands playing, or maybe a poet or two. You never know what you find and where in the Lowest Mill you might find it.

Art, chocolates and tea pictures attached so you can see what I am talking about. Piper and Leaf...I highly recommend everything on the menu. A good start for a good shopping trip.

name: Tim Edwards
text: Plenty of parking.   Little difficult to find.   Lots of great artists and lots of walking.. several restaurants.

name: Joey Ellerbee
text: Liked getting lost in this place. Very cool.

name: MV Freeman
text:
This is a fabulous place with wonderful artist studios, a confection shop, coffee shop, tea shop and a Mediterranean place-- but the food is the side bar (all of it outstanding)- it's the art, painting, pottery, mixed media, jewelery places which display the wonderful talent in this area. Well worth the visit.
Note: nothing really opens until 12 weekdays (tea/coffee open earlier), and I am unsure about the weekends.

name: KYLE GOOS
text: This place is awesome! Haven't been back in a while , but can't wait to bring the family again. There's something there for everyone

name: Bona Indraputra
text: Great place to hang out and meet

name: Sean Hogan
text: Great cafe/ coffeehouse.  I had the minnie peanut butter cake and iced latte, it was delicious! I will love to swing by here again next time I'm in town.

name: Elizabeth Douglas
text: Fantastic venue! We loved attending the Snowball held here and look forward to other events at this location. The space was really well used and seemed like the kind of place that could be easily transformed depending on the type of event taking place. Loved the fact admission was only $10 per person. Parking was easy as the lot was spacious. Looking forward to visiting again.

name: Jerome A Powell
text: Housed in an old mill facility, Lowe Mill is the country's largest privately owned arts center. Artists of all genres have studios here and on Saturdays, the Artist Market is set up for one-time sellers to hawk their wares. The creaky wood floors hint at the building's age while modern art remind visitors of our space program ties. It's a great place to visit on Saturdays to roam and shop.

name: Myra L Walker-Williams
text: This is truly a hidden gem!! I was there for a photo shoot of my daughter with Huntsville's own Dokk Savage Photographer. He found a venue to fit exactly what she was needing. I'm planning another trip back, because you cannot possibly take in all of this awesomeness in a day. I suggest three days minimum.

name: Bryan Singer
text: This has been a real joy to watch develop over the years.  Don't miss on your trip to Huntsville!!

name: Deborah Holt
text: Benefit at Lowe Mill old cotton mill transformed into a music art venue welcomes the public all ages and brings together a community of artists weirdos and love

name: Nathan Stewart
text:
I went during comic con, but apart from the event vendors, the regular shop vendors have a ton of things to offer. The chocolate shop has amazing flavors, and there are several food places that looked delicious. We also swung by several art shops which had a lot of interesting items, and picked up some miniatures. There are several studios that offer electronic camps/lessons and art lessons, there's even a cigar guitar class.

Tl;dr; go check this place out, you'll probably find something you like.

name: Emmanuel Leonard
text: I came here on a Saturday towards the end of the day so a lot of the shops were closed. I still enjoyed my time walking around and looking at the various art pieces they had displayed. I would go again but probably in the early afternoon.

name: Mike G
text: Tons of small local artistry shops that cover a myriad of specialties along with some great little food spots. Wonderful way to waste a day and support local artists.

name: Tammy Wolfe
text:
The Halloween candy trail was great was only about 6 cars left handout candy but my grandbaby was still happy  about it
Thank to who all were there and lowe mill for doing this

name: Hector Murrieta
text: Great place to hang out, see art, listen to music, places to paint, etc. Definitely worth a visit (or a dozen).

name: S Clay
text: I love this place, many different types of art. Spent hours looking, and we even bought a small painting. Found a small place to eat and spent most of the afternoon looking!

name: Rosemary Davidson
text: So many neat little shops and artists. A treasure in the community.

name: John Beck (BeekrJR)
text: A great area for local talent to share their products and passions

name: Deitrick Smart
text: New more food places.

name: Kayla VanEtten
text: I love Lowe Mill it's gotten so much bigger! I remember when we used to call it the flying monkey and go to the market on Saturdays. I've recently purchased tickets to an "R rated magic show" there one night which was great. I also went to yule y'all and will definitely be back soon! I love so many things about this place.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Creative art center. Many talented artisans. I liked that one can learn various crafts. If you like the weird and artsy angle, plenty of that.  Some great gourmet food and chocolate confections. An experience worth checking out.

name: John Muhlhauser
text: Very cool place to spend your time in the weekend. It's free to get it, and there are many things to do and observe different kind of arts.

name: Kimberly Bowie
text: Very fun artsy environment. Comfortable Place to chill and eat. Great place to host fashion events when additional lighting is considered. Respectful, helpful staff.

name: Brian White
text: Great wholesome fun for the whole family. Perfect for a date night too. Love this place. Huntsville is lucky to have a place like this.

name: Brandie Robinson
text: I love this place!

name: Tonya Sitko
text: Very unique collection of artist studios in an old mill/factory.  Attempts have been made to retain the factory vibe/feel.  Wear good walking shoes when you visit, and leave plenty of time to explore, eat pizza, eat a popsicle, and shop!

name: D'Arcy Burgess
text: Love this place! Grab a vegan/vegetarian meal from Chef Will's while you're there! Amazing food!

name: Robert Rivera
text:
Simply, awesome and genuine ambiance for the creative mind! I wish there would be properties like this in Miami area.

Lots of options of work and talent to look & feel the work being done and sold.

The best environment I have experienced in the US.  This is a must visit! For the whole family.

Pros:
- great location in Huntsville
- ample parking
- good for the true coffee fanatic (Alchemy)!
- spaces are well laid out, studios and offices have great light and window openings to see from inside the walkway
- halls have ample walking space
- plenty of excellent food options

Cons
- none found yet!

Simply love it! Will be a definite regular customer!

name: Lapping PoofPoof
text: Nice knit stuffed kitties

name: Sally MacDonald
text: Because of covid, not much was open.  Very few artists working.  Also it was confusing to find your way around.  The diagrams on the walls were not very helpful.

name: Pitts Burgher
text: Everyone should go and see all of the local artist and crafters who have their stores set up there. Food and drink are available. Check out 5 Points Elements. Great store.

name: John VanAntwerp
text: Really nice artist venue.  I wish more places had been open.

name: Vanessa Bowser
text: Great space and really awesome vendors. We visited on a Saturday and there were artists there at working on projects. Many were very visible, friendly, and eager to discuss their work. A few food vendors located inside and there is an art supply store! I will definitely go back for another visit!

name: Sandra Yokem
text: First time there. Took my 12 year old granddaughter and WOW we had a great time

name: Gary Sheffer
text: Great eclectic environment.  Totally chill with fabulous art and good food stalls.

name: Stephen Walls
text: Hard to beat the variety of entertainment you can get for free at Lowe Mill. The drive-in night was an interestkng mix of dark comedy short films.

name: Beth Taylor
text: What a fun way to #buylocal! There's really something for everyone, whether you're trying to find a unique gift for a friend or just would like to try some fresh kombucha this is the place for you!

name: Dominique Brooks
text: Chef Will is food is Amazing

name: Kathy Edgar
text: Perfect place to fill your day. Make sure you check out the following: Piper and Leaf Tea, Chris Wade at Studio 202, White Rabbit Records, and Pizzelle's Confections.

name: Rachel Haggard
text: Love this place, wish they had this up North

name: Nathan Stewart
text:
I went during comic con, but apart from the event vendors, the regular shop vendors have a ton of things to offer. The chocolate shop has amazing flavors, and there are several food places that looked delicious. We also swung by several art shops which had a lot of interesting items, and picked up some miniatures. There are several studios that offer electronic camps/lessons and art lessons, there's even a cigar guitar class.

Tl;dr; go check this place out, you'll probably find something you like.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Creative art center. Many talented artisans. I liked that one can learn various crafts. If you like the weird and artsy angle, plenty of that.  Some great gourmet food and chocolate confections. An experience worth checking out.

name: Kimberly Midkiff
text: Lots of fine art and entertainment.

name: Tonya Sitko
text: Very unique collection of artist studios in an old mill/factory.  Attempts have been made to retain the factory vibe/feel.  Wear good walking shoes when you visit, and leave plenty of time to explore, eat pizza, eat a popsicle, and shop!

name: Justin Malone
text: I rarely get to enjoy the Mill due to my own conflicting work hours.  However, it never disappoints!  It's always an adventure here.

name: Brandie Robinson
text: I love this place!

name: Mark Stevenson
text: Great place...always something new.

name: D'Arcy Burgess
text: Love this place! Grab a vegan/vegetarian meal from Chef Will's while you're there! Amazing food!

name: Kaylee Powell
text: Such a fun, eclectic environment, and a great place to learn, take classes, or observe the creative process. Suzy's is great, and so is the happy tummy restaurant! I'll be back!

name: Claudette Patton
text: I love it here

name: Callie Livesay
text: This place is amazing for all of the cool things you can do there! Saturdays they have artist markets with local artists selling their wares, plus the permanent shops they have there. Lots of good places to eat also. They host comedy shows, music shows, even circus sideshows! It's really the most unique arts place in Huntsville

name: Thomas Garner
text: Multitude of things to do here, They have everything from pop up artist shops to a chocolate store with amazing coffee. Perfect place for a date or just a fun day trip if you are near huntsville.

name: Tamyra Sampson
text: We took pictures here.  Its a beautiful place for this.

name: Charles Wildman
text: First time at Lowe Mill, everyone should go check it out

name: Crisa Slusher
text: Get chocolate! Not only is it stunning, it's equally delicious. Great destination! Ride the elevator. Swing on the 2nd floor. Find the giant metal bug. Buy art. Have a glorious time.

name: Donna
text: Saturdays at the Mill are the best!

name: Katelyn G
text: We've been on both a weekday and Saturday. The variety of artists are nice with lots of beautiful and some unique art. There were some artists who were closed both days which was difficult to navigate if you wanted to visit them. But definitely worth visiting and taking any out of towners who are into art.

name: Roberto Fuschi
text: Really cool concept; art stores, pinball machine store ..good lunch too

name: Paul Godsey
text: Good place to look and explore

name: John Smith
text: Saturday night obscure films were exactly what they sound like: Saturday night and obscure. Really enjoyed the tradition of honking after a film finished to show interest, did not enjoy pressure to honk when I personally didn't enjoy a short film.

name: Cameron Page
text: So creative! Amazing arts center

name: bev bauer
text: Wonderful artwork friendly people in a historical environment. Not in every city rare.

name: PATRICIA MENDEZ
text: I fell in love with Lowe the first time I visited it. I sold my baked goods at the Flying Monkey Arts gig on Saturday’s. I no longer live in HSV but the 4 years I lived there we always spent time at the Mill. I’ve heard that Lowe Mill is home to the largest arts facility in the US. Go Huntsville! The swing dancing in the theater was always the cat’s pajamas!  Piper Leaf provides the best tea by far! You can buy a mason jar and get your tea it every time you visit Piper Leaf. There  is so much to do... concerts on the dock... good eats...beautiful artwork...cool studios... funky shops. I can go on but it’s best if y’all check it out y’all selves. I miss my beloved Lowe Mill. Guess I’ll have to visit soon.

name: Cheyenne Michelli
text: My second home. I have made many dear friends here over the years and I wouldn't trade the memories I have there for anything. Highly recommend! The community is extremely diverse

name: Nyki Pastuszka
text: Instead of reading my thoughts, you should already be here exploring what huntsville artists have to offer. As accessible as this hub is... you got no excuse for not visiting at least ONCE while you're in town.... and if you're a native I hope that you're only reading this because you're about to leave your own awesome review!

name: Barb Graybeal
text:
First visit to Mountain Valley Pizzeria.  We are now permanent customers!  This will be part of each visit to H'ville.  The pizza and the bread were made exactly  the way we love.  It is not your
corner pick up and run pizza.  It's a completely new experience.

name: Jose Olivero
text: Sent to have my bicycle check. Very helpful staff.

name: Jacob Benning
text: A bit out of the way, but a trip worth noting for artists or someone looking to burn an hour or two.  There's a decent amount of parking, so no worries about mile-long hikes.  Despite the rustic conditions, and an odd bat-related smell in one of the stairwells (as noted on a painted wall acknowledging the offending smell) the experience was an enjoyable one.  On each floor, the halls are lined with studios for independent artists, each as unique as a fingerprint.  Would happily return for the art and the wide range of food ranging from tea to shaorma.

name: ladyrob4110
text: I love the record store

name: Michael Pukish
text: Well, there are some quaint places that individually do specific foods, desserts, cafe stuff right, but overall there's something not quite aligned with the hype.. For certain, all the prices are more than a bit high. And it's not their fault, but I've never been there when it's "hopping with excitement".  I like the buildings and the ambience, but maybe things pick up and it takes on a new character during special events. I haven't made it there for that yet, and maybe that will change my mind.

name: HLLW
text: All the local art was probably the most fascinating thing, very calming area to be in plus the multitudes of mini businesses in the building were interesting to go by.  I would highly recommend the paper flower shop (can't remember the name of it off the top of my head) but definitely go there for a cute gift for your S.O.  They can last several years.

name: Callie Livesay
text: This place is amazing for all of the cool things you can do there! Saturdays they have artist markets with local artists selling their wares, plus the permanent shops they have there. Lots of good places to eat also. They host comedy shows, music shows, even circus sideshows! It's really the most unique arts place in Huntsville

name: Tamyra Sampson
text: We took pictures here.  Its a beautiful place for this.

name: Winston Howard
text: Love the location and the hold vibe was great. I could see this place as a causal hangout and for dates

name: Claudette Patton
text: I love it here

name: Donna
text: Saturdays at the Mill are the best!

name: Paul Godsey
text: Good place to look and explore

name: Christi Doyle
text: One of my favorite places.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator. They have a farmers market on Saturday's You can explore the inside buy art, homemade jewery, all kinds of pretty things, baked goodies, there a couple photo studios, a comic book area, a few restaurants, even get a cartoonist draw a picture of you.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator. They have a farmers market on Saturday's You can explore the inside buy art, homemade jewery, all kinds of pretty things, baked goodies, there a couple photo studios, a comic book area, a few restaurants, even get a cartoonist draw a picture of you.

name: Jacob Benning
text: A bit out of the way, but a trip worth noting for artists or someone looking to burn an hour or two.  There's a decent amount of parking, so no worries about mile-long hikes.  Despite the rustic conditions, and an odd bat-related smell in one of the stairwells (as noted on a painted wall acknowledging the offending smell) the experience was an enjoyable one.  On each floor, the halls are lined with studios for independent artists, each as unique as a fingerprint.  Would happily return for the art and the wide range of food ranging from tea to shaorma.

name: Nyki Pastuszka
text: Instead of reading my thoughts, you should already be here exploring what huntsville artists have to offer. As accessible as this hub is... you got no excuse for not visiting at least ONCE while you're in town.... and if you're a native I hope that you're only reading this because you're about to leave your own awesome review!

name: Denise Marsh
text: Spectacular history tied into Lowe Mill. Each place we visited had friendly, helpful employees.

name: LaShonda Scott Robinson
text: A wonderful place for art lovers!

name: John Smith
text: Saturday night obscure films were exactly what they sound like: Saturday night and obscure. Really enjoyed the tradition of honking after a film finished to show interest, did not enjoy pressure to honk when I personally didn't enjoy a short film.

name: Christi Doyle
text: One of my favorite places.

name: Sara Hardin
text: My daughter is there this week with Hsv City Schools..Steam Works project!! We Love Lowe Mill!!

name: Damian Quattlebaum
text: Very artsy. Some really cool displays and shops. While it was entertaining, if there had been a few more dining options, we probably would've spent more time here. If you go, ride the one working elevator and get a quick dose of history about the building.

name: Christian Leach
text: One of the best places to go in Huntsville! They have a variety of shops and artist workspaces. There is a weekly artist market on the weekends filled with all sorts of neat stuff!

name: Justin Malone
text: I rarely get to enjoy the Mill due to my own conflicting work hours.  However, it never disappoints!  It's always an adventure here.

name: Lexy Senft
text: So stimulating to see so much art and the lenses through which others view the world. Lots of vegan options around when it comes to food. Poetry slams and live music. Easily one the best spots to visit in Huntsville.

name: Joy Goodloe
text: Limited art exhibits.

name: Elizabeth Niedfeldt
text: Very cool artist studios!  The history of the building is incredible with multiple floors and hallways! We went there trick-or-treating,  it was busy, but fun for my granddaughter! Would go again to listen to music....!

name: Winchester Jude
text: So much to see and activities to take part in. Many fun and inspiring events throughout the year. So many fine artists in one place. Arts & music abound.

name: Elizah Polard
text: This place has so much to offer to any artistry community. Love to go in here and just walk around. Will say I miss the vintage clothing store that was on the second level. My eyes are never dull in this place amazing art.

name: Hans Ruoss
text: Neat historic setting in old textile mill.  Packed with artisans of various trades, good food places, and some music.  Easy to navigate and very unique.

name: Jerome White
text: Great exhibits along with tons of awesome classes.

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: I randomly found this on a web site when looking for things to do in Huntsville. Although I haven't experienced it yet, they host many types of outdoor concerts on the docks. The mill is home to many artist studios and plans are to open more soon. Every Saturday art is on display and for sale. Great husband and wife to girlfriend trip. The sandwich shop was good but SLOW. Still worth the wait but plan ahead and don't get in line when you are starving. I look for this to become really popular.

name: Abigail Hancock
text: I loved this place for years, so it was the perfect place for me to want to have my prom pictures taken. Except I heard rumors that they would be charging people and extortionate amount just to  let us in to take pictures with an iPhone. I thought this was crazy so I called the night before prom to confirm and they said yes they would be charging $15 per person to be allowed in for pictures, I even stated clearly that we just wanted pics with a phone not a real photographer and still they said we would have to have buy the pass. Which is ridiculous when on any other day the place is free to enter. Prom alone already cost so much I couldn’t afford to pay $45 just for me and my date and his mom to take pictures of us with her cell phone. The day of prom it poured rain so I ended up not having any pictures at all since everywhere else in town is outdoors, while the group we had intended to take pictures somewhere else with ended up going to Lowe mill and nobody made them pay for a thing. I was completely put off and I’ll never be able to go back and enjoy it the same again.

name: Vickie Smith
text: Super cool artsy community to find originals!!

name: Jesse Latimer
text: Always fun to walk around the art studios and meet people! There's always something going on, and of course I get to visit Piper & Leaf too. :-D Lowe Mill is on the top of my list of places to take visitors to Huntsville.

name: Justin Richards
text: Really enjoyable to walk through and check out all of the artists, and the varied styles of everyone involved.

name: Nghia Huynh
text: One of the coolest places to visit in all of Huntsville. The Lowe Mill contains a variety of local art, food, and accessory vendors. They occasionally offer live music performance out on the lawn and art classes all year round. It's a great spot for families and all ages alike.

name: Mathew Clements
text: Excellent use of an old industrial era building.  The artists we friendly but things were pricey.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator. They have a farmers market on Saturday's You can explore the inside buy art, homemade jewery, all kinds of pretty things, baked goodies, there a couple photo studios, a comic book area, a few restaurants, even get a cartoonist draw a picture of you.

name: Arthur Reynolds
text: Interesting place to browse for things of the arts and crafts category. Several classes on how to make things are held here too. The building is massive and easy to get lost in and around.

name: Sheri Spuhl
text: Gotta love this place just as a creative indulgence & motivator. It's a feast for your eyeballs. It's a fun day trip. We like the music nights in the warm weather.

name: Brian Presson
text: Lowe Mill has intriguing artwork displays to tour through on all three floors, with the sale of beverages and t-shirts located at ground level to keep visitors preoccupied. There is also a pool table for everyone to share. I stop by here many times when entering Huntsville to see what exhibits they have for the week. I have talked to a few of the workers, and all of them have interesting stories to share about themselves. Admittance is free.

name: chloe-symone barnett
text: If you love art, and like to support local artists or get commissioned work done, you'll like this neat place. There are food options, tea options etc. There is quite a bit to see here, check it out. One place id suggest an art enthusiast visiting huntsville to go.

name: Hannah Restrepo
text: It's a good place for kids. Staff is a little low. The staff is is knowledgeable about the classes they teach. My sister goes here for a Dungeons and Dragons class. I wrote her opinion.

name: Live Concerts
text: Really cool and artsy place. If you can figure out where the entrance is, you'll have a good time.

name: Lexy Senft
text: So stimulating to see so much art and the lenses through which others view the world. Lots of vegan options around when it comes to food. Poetry slams and live music. Easily one the best spots to visit in Huntsville.

name: sheila larson
text: First of all,  what a great use of an old building! Tons of interesting artwork and artists.  On weekends they have an artist "flea market" called the flying monkey.  I can spend way to much time and money there.  Painters, potters, woodworkers, yarn arts,  quilters,  mixed media. There are a couple eateries/cafe's, coffee shops, even a place that makes popcicles! And it's a dog friendly space.  I noticed one of the eateries had a dog tie out area. I haven't tried out any of the eateries,  but they must be pretty good because they're always busy.  If you have some time to kill,  or out of town guests who like to shop, it's a great place to spend a few hours. Some of the artists teach classes too.  One of these daddy's,  it's my intention to sign up for one.

name: chaithanya kompella
text: Amazing art and inspiring artists !

name: Howard Rochelle
text: Always a good environment. Friendly people, so many artists, and open doors all along tbe hallways. Great place to meet your local artists and get more involved.

name: Elizabeth Niedfeldt
text: Very cool artist studios!  The history of the building is incredible with multiple floors and hallways! We went there trick-or-treating,  it was busy, but fun for my granddaughter! Would go again to listen to music....!

name: Jesse Latimer
text: Always fun to walk around the art studios and meet people! There's always something going on, and of course I get to visit Piper & Leaf too. :-D Lowe Mill is on the top of my list of places to take visitors to Huntsville.

name: Victoria Bailey
text: You can spend hours and hours here talking with local artists and connecting with people in the community! I visit Lowe Mill everytime I'm in AL and it's great to see the growth and improvements going on here! I'm looking forward to my next visit!

name: David Wallner
text: Lowe Mill is awesome. Saw Funkmaster Seeds! Jam out. Earlier we were invited into the Tangled Strings, where outkast's producer was speaking.

name: Grant Stephens
text: Lowe Mill is Huntsville's hangout spot for those who enjoy a chill environment. This place is clearly targeted toward millennials/Gen Zs. It is a fun place to hang out with this type of crowd, and can even make for a good place to have a date. I would recommend visiting here at least once.

name: Melanie Klinner
text: Always love going out to Lowe Mill to wander around the galleries and sometimes listen to music. All the gallery owners seem very passionate about their work and super friendly and ready to answer questions. My friend Aaryn just opened an art studio in 325, so stop by, check it out and say hello.

name: Morgann Peters
text: Lowe Mill is the best little gem in Huntsville. I have never felt more wonder and acceptance in such a place. People are encouraged to express all of their creativity here, and it's just one of the most amazing places to shop and meet people that I've ever been. I will return again and again.

name: John Restrepo
text: The inside is nice and the programs are good. The staff is knowledgeable but for a place that big, I think they might need 1 or 2 more staff members.

name: Christian Leach
text: One of the best places to go in Huntsville! They have a variety of shops and artist workspaces. There is a weekly artist market on the weekends filled with all sorts of neat stuff!

name: M Blevins
text: I follow Lowe on Instagram but had no idea the span of the place! I'm not sure I saw it all, as it was a bit overwhelming. Totally inspiring to see so many artists working hard in one building. What a great community and place to get local art!

name: Ja Behrend
text: Great shops and friendly people. The cigar box guitar shop was awesome and the knowledge staff were friendly, helpful, and informative. Great place!

name: Steve Ewing
text: Nice places

name: Merkyl999x
text:
Great complex that's always growing and changing.

Great art, great food, venues for events, music shows, STEM/STEAM businesses and events.

Great place to visit with the family on Saturday with an artist's market in the Flying Monkey area.  (Keep in mind that it's filled with private art studios, so if you're particular about what your family is exposed to, maybe scout it out first, but in general, the artists are very accepting of the fact that it's a rather public venue and keep their studio-fronts family-friendly.)

Lunch during the week is definitely an option, but keep in mind the main building doesn't get unlocked until 12.

You can still get access to some of the outside options, such as Happy Tummy and Pizzelle's since they aren't in the main complex.

name: Jalyn Kinsella
text: This was such a cool experience! Not a place you go to everyday. Lots of cool art and unique stores. Glad I stopped here while in the area. Definitely would recommend to any tourists. The kombucha bar was a really neat place and the kombucha was delicious!!! If you are in the area, highly recommend stopping here!

name: Quincia “Quin” The Queen
text: One of my favorite places!

name: Lana Heller
text: We went here for a Halloween thing my daughter is 3 and she looks loved. I also did. I've never been and would love to go again!!! 💖

name: Ashleigh
text: Awesome industrial building with great art studios/stores. Loved this place! Highly recommend.

name: John Harchanko
text: For this kind of place, the experience is what you make of it. Explore, shop, appreciate, talk to artists, listen to music, eat. For art, I like to start at the Huntsville Art League on the second floor to see what's new. They have a good sampling of the better artists. Summertime is always music on the docks. Cool place with always a surprise new artist exhibit around the corner.

name: Brooke Simmons
text: First time here and it was wonderful! The perfect saturday day date for my husband and I. We enjoyed some really good pizza Mountain Valley Pizzeria and walked around talking and admiring all the beautiful work.

name: Dawn Haga
text: So much cool places and things to do.  Kids love it as well as adults.  For all ages. Except toddlers,  they would b bored

name: Etta Lea
text: It’s so great to have such a great space and arts incubator here... a wonderful way to preserve Huntsville’s history while forging the way toward a culturally-rich future! I usually go to Lowe Mill for a comedy show, music or poetry at the Flying Monkey Theatre, but it’s also great to spend a few hours walking around to look at the arts, crafts and artists’ studios.

name: Absterdam
text: Lots of art studios that sell and provide artistic services!

name: Sara Hardin
text: My daughter is there this week with Hsv City Schools..Steam Works project!! We Love Lowe Mill!!

name: Howard Rochelle
text: Always a good environment. Friendly people, so many artists, and open doors all along tbe hallways. Great place to meet your local artists and get more involved.

name: Arthur Reynolds
text: Interesting place to browse for things of the arts and crafts category. Several classes on how to make things are held here too. The building is massive and easy to get lost in and around.

name: Wilton Brown
text: Fun place. Lots of cool arts and Huntsville flavor ;)

name: Morgan Bonner
text: Confusing layout but fun to navigate. If you're going, take someone who has been before. Great company, food, and art. Picture of Alchemy attached

name: Merkyl999x
text:
Great complex that's always growing and changing.

Great art, great food, venues for events, music shows, STEM/STEAM businesses and events.

Great place to visit with the family on Saturday with an artist's market in the Flying Monkey area.  (Keep in mind that it's filled with private art studios, so if you're particular about what your family is exposed to, maybe scout it out first, but in general, the artists are very accepting of the fact that it's a rather public venue and keep their studio-fronts family-friendly.)

Lunch during the week is definitely an option, but keep in mind the main building doesn't get unlocked until 12.

You can still get access to some of the outside options, such as Happy Tummy and Pizzelle's since they aren't in the main complex.

name: Molly Ruth Skiles
text: What a unique and entertaining experience! On the day we went there was a car boot sale, with all kinds of interesting things being offered. We had coffee tea, chocolates, saw stores offering art and art supplies of just about any sort one could imagine, and enjoyed exploring the many floors and areas of the facility. A truly magnificent, multi-sensory experience.

name: Ashleigh
text: Awesome industrial building with great art studios/stores. Loved this place! Highly recommend.

name: Etta Lea
text: It’s so great to have such a great space and arts incubator here... a wonderful way to preserve Huntsville’s history while forging the way toward a culturally-rich future! I usually go to Lowe Mill for a comedy show, music or poetry at the Flying Monkey Theatre, but it’s also great to spend a few hours walking around to look at the arts, crafts and artists’ studios.

name: Heather Brecht (BuG)
text: Wow..I never knew how much entertainment is local to me I need to get out more!!!

name: Ja Behrend
text: Great shops and friendly people. The cigar box guitar shop was awesome and the knowledge staff were friendly, helpful, and informative. Great place!

name: Lana Heller
text: We went here for a Halloween thing my daughter is 3 and she looks loved. I also did. I've never been and would love to go again!!! 💖

name: Heather Peavy
text: This is my favorite place in Huntsville. Ever since I moved to the area people told me to go to the Lowe Mill, you'll love the Lowe Mill. And they were not wrong. It's a melting pot of amazing artists and you can be just about anyone and fit in. I tell everyone about the Lowe Mill and the events that go on there. You won't find another place in town with such a high concentration of amazing people and art.

name: Jauhar Farid
text: You just can't beat good public art. Great atmosphere for the whole family. I'm definitely a fan!

name: Nick Roman (Roastt_Beef)
text: I went with some of my staff to Piper and Leaf whose tea was excellent! We also walked around Lowe Mill for some time just enjoying the aesthetic of it all. There was no specific order to the little shops I saw but they all look very Interesting. There was also a few indoor swing sets that were fully functional and could fit 2 people at once. There was also an arcade cabinet offering free plays of Mrs. Pacman and Galaga so we all had a great time!

name: Asher Berry
text: Cool place with huge diversity of studios and shops

name: Ashley Sullivan
text: Love. Love. Love. This is a favorite spot to visit. Piper and leaf always draws us in. Love everything about this place. Plenty to see and do. Ever changing offerings in the stores. And I always seem to find things I've never noticed before. The murals are amazing. The art is amazing. And the people are always fantastic. I tell everyone I can to visit. It is truly a hidden gem.

name: Daniel Whisenant
text: Great collection of local artist and members of Huntsville's community that gives an insight into the keep huntsville weird side of things.

name: Katelyn Miller
text: One of my favorite places in huntsville!! full of so much history and talented artists! the guitar shop inside is my brother's favorite place in the world. piper and leaf and all of the artists and Pizzelle's are my favorites!

name: Caleb Doerr
text: Service was fantastic and the Dracula crepe was crispy and fresh.

name: Aaron Spiegle
text: Really cool concept, vendors, and artists but kind of confusing to navigate and find the vendor you're looking for if you've never been there before.

name: Rich B
text: Really cool maker's space. A lot of creative energy in the building. This photo is metal sculptor Micah Gregg.

name: B E
text: I love this place! Lowe Mill is a great local place to see all of the amazing artisans that Huntsville has to offer! Check out their event page because they always have things going on!!

name: Glenda Lambert
text: One of my favorite places

name: Karen
text: We always enjoy this place. Fun to walk and browse and find something from a vendor.

name: Joe Staton
